chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer
Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis A. Pourchot-Hein

records.addlTxt:
2:17 PM Defendant Travis A. Pourchot-Hein appeared by video.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared by phone for Travis A. Pourchot-Hein.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
22TR176 tracking with 22CF19:
Atty Johnson met with the DA last week and his client is going to accept an offer; requests a plea/sentencing date be set out to January.

BY THE COURT:  Set plea/sentencing in January.
bond continued
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 9, 2023 at 11:30 am.
Status hearing on September 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Travis A. Pourchot-Hein in court.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court for Travis A. Pourchot-Hein. 
22CF19, 22TR176
Atty Johnson states his client will waive the preliminary hearing.  Court questions defendant and finds the waiver of preliminary hearing is being made freely, voluntarily & intelligently.
BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings. 

Atty Johnson received the Information and waives it's reading.  Requests Court enter Not Guilty plea to each count. Court advises defendant of the maximum penalties. BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. Set for status.
Status hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on September 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:16 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Travis A. Pourchot-Hein appeared by video.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared by video for Travis A. Pourchot-Hein. 
Atty Johnson received an offer that he needs to discuss with his client; requests a status in August.  Court notes that an amended complaint was filed.

Atty Johnson states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the amended criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties of the added charges.  Defendant understands. 

BY THE COURT:  Set Preliminary Hearing
Time limits continued to be waived
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:48 PM Defendant Travis A. Pourchot-Hein appeared by video.  Attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared by video for Travis A. Pourchot-Hein. 
Atty Johnson received an offer today from the State and will need to look into prior convictions; requests another status.

BY THE COURT:  Set for status
Status hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing on June 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing on April 18, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

10:34 AM Defendant Travis A. Pourchot-Hein appeared by video means with Attorney Erik C. Johnson. Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared for State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Johnson received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of the maximum penalties.  Atty Johnson waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court questions defendant.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds time limits have been waived.  Bond continued.  Status hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
for Leave to File Additional Motions

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on March 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol    *No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license    *Not to go on the premises of any bar, tavern or establishment that alcohol is the main business

03:43 PM Defendant Travis A. Pourchot-Hein appeared by video means from Marquette County Jail. Prosecuting Atty Clifford C. Burdon appeared for State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.    Court confirms address and phone.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.
  Court finds probable cause for the charge for Riverside purposes.

Atty Burdon requests a $500 cash bond with conditions.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Cash bond with conditions:
  *Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol
  *No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
  *Not to go on the premises of any bar, tavern or establishment that alcohol is the main business  Initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
